info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 02 at 12:57AM EST until January 02 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow, falling heavily at times, along with areas of shallow blowing snow, together creating hazardous travel especially on secondary roads. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches are expected with locally higher amounts possible mainly over Lake County, IL and northern Cook County. Northeast winds could gust up to 35 mph through early overnight, especially near the lake. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Indiana and northeast Illinois. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could become very difficult. Blowing snow after sunset this evening could significantly reduce visibility, especially along the Lake Michigan shoreline. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow rates are expected through about midnight tonight.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
